intro: Ludwigia hastata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments. The plant features slender, branching stems and elongated, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens. Ludwigia hastata is also valued for its ability to provide habitat for aquatic invertebrates and fish.
